notes.text:
Keep oil at consistent temperature
Pat fish dry before battering
Double-fry chips for extra crispiness

steps.descr: Heat oil to 180°C in a deep fryer

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started by heating the oil to 180°C. Make sure it's nice and hot!

steps.instructions: Heat oil to 180°C in a deep fryer

steps.descr: Par-boil chips for 5 minutes, drain and dry

on_enter.say: Let's par-boil those chips for 5 minutes. Once done, drain them well and pat them dry.

steps.instructions: Par-boil chips for 5 minutes, drain and dry

steps.descr: Fry chips until golden and crispy, set aside

on_enter.say: Now, let's fry those chips until they're beautifully golden and crispy. You'll know they're ready when they have that lovely crunch.

steps.instructions: Fry chips until golden and crispy, set aside

steps.descr: Make batter by whisking flour with beer until smooth

on_enter.say: Let's make that batter! Whisk the flour with the beer until it's nice and smooth. It should be a lovely, thick consistency.

steps.instructions: Make batter by whisking flour with beer until smooth

steps.descr: Dip fish in batter and carefully lower into hot oil

on_enter.say: Now, dip each piece of fish into the batter and carefully lower it into the hot oil. Be gentle!

steps.instructions: Dip fish in batter and carefully lower into hot oil

steps.descr: Fry fish for 5-6 minutes until golden and crispy

on_enter.say: Time to fry the fish for 5 to 6 minutes. You'll know it's done when it's golden and crispy. Listen for that sizzle!

steps.instructions: Fry fish for 5-6 minutes until golden and crispy

steps.descr: Serve immediately with chips, salt, and vinegar

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Now, let's serve up your delicious fish and chips with a sprinkle of salt and a dash of vinegar. Enjoy!

steps.instructions: Serve immediately with chips, salt, and vinegar

recipe.title: Fish and Chips
recipe.description: Classic British comfort food with crispy battered fish and golden chips
